trans-unit.source: Represents a panel that lays out cells and column headers in a data grid.
The DataGridCellsPanel is used as the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsPanel%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridCellsPresenter> to lay out cells in a row.
It is used as the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsPanel%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridColumnHeadersPresenter> to lay out column headers.
The panel arranges cells horizontally and uses each cell's column information to determine the correct size for each cell.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCellsPanel"></xref> class.
Determines the final size and placement of the panel.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCellsPanel> class uses the ArrangeOverride method to lay out the cells that are visible.
Cells that are not visible are virtualized.
The maximum size that the panel can occupy.
The final size and placement of the panel.
Scrolls the viewport to the item at the specified index.
The index of the item that should become visible.
The index is out of range.
Determines the desired size of the panel.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCellsPanel> class uses the MeasureOverride method to determine which cells are visible and which cells are virtualized.
The maximum size that the panel can occupy.
The desired size of the panel.
Called when the collection of children in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> is cleared.
Indicates that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.IsItemsHost*> property value has changed.
The old value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.IsItemsHost*> property.
The new value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.IsItemsHost*> property.
Updates the visible cells when an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items*> collection has changed.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The OnItemsChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The object that raised the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerGenerator.ItemsChanged"></xref> event.
The data for the event.
